data.author: hyunsehyun
data.message:
pose graph, new node/loop closure event publisher (#818)

* Add pose graph publishing with event system (#12)

- Add PoseGraph, NewNodeEvent, and LoopClosureEvent messages
- Implement LoopClosureListener for loop closure detection
- Add publishers for pose graph, new node events, and loop closure events
- Optimize pose graph publishing with atomic flag and try_lock
- Add incremental updates via new_node_event for efficiency
- Full pose graph published only on loop closure events

Co-authored-by: hyunsehyun <wjwjwj20002@gachon.ac.kr>

* fix the build error

* change the code that newNodeEvent can pub several edge

* update readme according  to modifying new_node_event

* Add EOF line, lint

* NewNodeEvent publishes one edge per node

* fix the linter error

* use GetVertex to optimize

* change to use public (getvertex is private)

* find only sequential matching

---------

Co-authored-by: hyunsehyun <wjwjwj20002@gachon.ac.kr>

* Added turtlebot multirobot mapping instructions

* linting and style changes

* minor readme corrections

data.author: Chuanhong Guo
data.message:
ceres: use Manifold instead of LocalParameterization for angles (#687)

LocalParameterization is deprecated in Ceres 2.1.0 and dropped in 2.2.0.
This commit fixes slam_toolbox build on Ubuntu 24.04.
The code are taken from the official slam/pose_graph_2d example:

https://ceres-solver.googlesource.com/ceres-solver/+/refs/tags/2.2.0/examples/slam/pose_graph_2d/

Signed-off-by: Chuanhong Guo <gch981213@gmail.com>

data.author: Keisuke KIMURA
data.message:
Convert nodes to lifecycle nodes (#561)

* feat: modify slam_toolbox_common and dependent code to be buildable with LifecycleNode

* feat: update slam_toolbox_common to LifecycleNode

* feat: update online_async_launch.py for auto starting

* fix: fixed cleanup process

* feat: LifecycleNode support for SynchronousSlamToolbox

* fix: remove manual configure

* feat: LifecycleNode support for LocalizationSlamToolbox

* feat: abstraction of some util functions used by merge_maps_kinematic

* feat: abstraction of func missed in b0512656ec6431ab6237545f59f5f922ae25e011

* LifecycleNode support for experimental nodes(lifelong/map_and_localization)

* fix: fixed on_shutdown func

* feat: update solver and laser_utils to use node_interface

* refactor: fixed indent

* feat: update loop_closure_assistant and map_save to use node_interface

* feat: update slam_mapper to use node_interface

* fix: revert initialize

* fix: fixed destructor of slam_toolbox_common, add warning when sent_transform in loop_closure_assistant

* fix: changed from node_interface to using node template

* fix: update CallbackReturn of typedef in slam_toolbox_map_and_localization.cpp

* fix: update node template

* fix: remove  flag. Update to allow joins in lifecycle cleaningup and shuttingdown state

* fix: change logging interface to the logger object.

* fix: pass state argument onto the function

* fix: update to reset and recreate threads and loop_closure_assistant on activation/deactivation.

* feat: added mutex to make get_current_state calls thread-safe

* feat: merge setParams and configure into on_configure

* fix: revert reset order

* refactor: reformat code

* fix: fixed variable name (get_state_id -> state_id)

* feat: updated threads join to use boost::interrupt.

* chore: install lifelong_slam_toolbox_node

* fix: fixed namespace, feat: support autostart

* feat: update parameter declaration position

* feat: update set position of processor_type

* fix: move reprocessing_transform initialization to activation stage

* feat: use set interfaces function in the activation stage

* fix: create map_and_localization ros interface in the activation stage

* fix: fixed reset order

* feat: follow the latest changes

- Lifecycle support for 'use_map_server' parameter
- updated to get namespace at initialization in map_server

* feat: lifecycle support of rviz_plugin

* feat: change stack memory within a node for Composable Node

* feat: support of bond connection for lifecycle_manager

* feat: change rviz_plugin logging to continuous

* fix: fixed typo, add EOF

data.author: James Ward
data.message:
Optional map saver (#633)

* Add parameter to stop map saver from being initialised

Map saver will subscribe to the map topic and force updates of the map
even when nothing else is subscribed.
This allows it to be turned off to save processing cycles.

* Add details of use_map_saver parameter to README

* Add defaulted-true use_map_saver parameter to launch configs

---------

Co-authored-by: James Ward <j.ward@sydney.edu.au>

data.author: Christen Lofland
data.message:
Bypass transform publish if transform from base_link to odom failed (#264)

In response to Issue #198: Instead of publishing an "Identity" transform if the base_link to odom transform fails, just skip this update.
While this is ultimately covering for likely bigger problem with the system (i.e. insufficient CPU power or out of spec settings), it produces a less catastrophic side effect.

data.message:
Localization window (#29)

* initial work to store and delete nodes/constraints

* memory management and first run deletion of graph, vertex adj, and optimizer

* optimization working with localization mode

* initialize the blocks map

* adding frontend localization for testing

* adding localization API like amcl

* adding matcher to use for dataset

* progress + alot alot alot alot of debug code to remove

* clarity

* more improvements

* stop crashing on access

* reorg + check for NULLs

* seemingly OK but with major leakage

* adding in NULl checks

* handling scan manager NULLs

* edges set to NULL defensively

* adding various hardenings

* minimizing map queries by caching scan pointer

* found crash -- working

* dealing with memory issues

* ceres node reduction

* compute verified

* v0

* adding readme updates

* rviz plugin, more corrections, and simplifications

* reenable process

* image update

* fix warning for quaternion in TF1

* moarrr

* step towards aligning odometry frames

* service update

* handle no map case

* load map to deserialize map

* adding rviz plugin for deserialization with position

* adding intermediate code so I can work remote tomorrow

* addtl cleanup

* working regiony COmmit to work from home tomorrow for cleanup

* working continue mapping region

data.message:
Continue mapping from initial location (#9)

* sdk

* stupid necessary refactoring

* readme updates

* fixing various serialization problems

* split out first node matching to another function so we can generalize it

* first node toggle + readme updates

* up to user to define if inverted, I think that's reasonable

* warning if you're going to not use the first node tool

* move old solvers to deprecated and API update

* fixing solver state

* rename launc files

* serialization + merging tool starts

* second stab at serialization

* reorg

* serialization changes

* serialization updates

* Map merging (#5)

* use binary archive for serialization, initialize laser to get sensor data, add transform initialization

* connect visualization markers with submaps

* try merging

* add transforms

* SAD SAD transforms

* working transform

* put submap origins in to zeros, map submap id and transform

* fix case when there is no transform applied

* submap markers put in the center of each submap, requested fixes

* small changes

* add typedefs for iterators, rename vars

* requested fixes

* fix

* switch to unique pointers

* add ref

* prepare for merginggg

* add continuous slamming, gui buttons for rviz tool

data.author: bhaskara
data.message:
Remove karto wrapper.

The wrapper depended on sba, which is no longer available in Electric.  Eventually this should be replaced with g2o, but for now I'm just removing so that at least the Karto libraries 
are available in electric.
